state.output:
<file>
00001| package runner
00002| 
00003| type Issue struct {
00004| 	ID        string  `json:"id"`
00005| 	IssueType string  `json:"issue_type"`
00006| 	Status    string  `json:"status"`
00007| 	Priority  *int    `json:"priority"`
00008| 	Children  []Issue `json:"children"`
00009| }
00010| 
00011| func SelectFirstOpenLeafTaskID(root Issue) string {
00012| 	if root.IssueType == "task" {
00013| 		if root.Status == "open" {
00014| 			return root.ID
00015| 		}
00016| 		return ""
00017| 	}
00018| 	return selectFirstOpenLeafInChildren(root.Children)
00019| }
00020| 
00021| func selectFirstOpenLeafInChildren(children []Issue) string {
00022| 	for _, item := range sortedIssues(children) {
00023| 		if item.Status != "open" {
00024| 			continue
00025| 		}
00026| 		switch item.IssueType {
00027| 		case "task":
00028| 			return item.ID
00029| 		case "epic":
00030| 			if len(item.Children) == 0 {
00031| 				continue
00032| 			}
00033| 			leaf := selectFirstOpenLeafInChildren(item.Children)
00034| 			if leaf != "" {
00035| 				return leaf
00036| 			}
00037| 		}
00038| 	}
00039| 	return ""
00040| }
00041| 
00042| func sortedIssues(items []Issue) []Issue {
00043| 	sorted := make([]Issue, len(items))
00044| 	copy(sorted, items)
00045| 	for i := 0; i < len(sorted)-1; i++ {
00046| 		for j := i + 1; j < len(sorted); j++ {
00047| 			if issuePriorityLess(sorted[j], sorted[i]) {
00048| 				sorted[i], sorted[j] = sorted[j], sorted[i]
00049| 			}
00050| 		}
00051| 	}
00052| 	return sorted
00053| }
00054| 
00055| func issuePriorityLess(a Issue, b Issue) bool {
00056| 	aPriority, aHasPriority := priorityValue(a)
00057| 	bPriority, bHasPriority := priorityValue(b)
00058| 	if aHasPriority && bHasPriority {
00059| 		return aPriority < bPriority
00060| 	}
00061| 	if aHasPriority && !bHasPriority {
00062| 		return true
00063| 	}
00064| 	if !aHasPriority && bHasPriority {
00065| 		return false
00066| 	}
00067| 	return false
00068| }
00069| 
00070| func priorityValue(issue Issue) (int, bool) {
00071| 	if issue.Priority == nil {
00072| 		return 0, false
00073| 	}
00074| 	return *issue.Priority, true
00075| }
00076| 

(End of file - total 76 lines)
</file>

state.output:
bd Onboarding

Add this minimal snippet to AGENTS.md (or create it):

--- BEGIN AGENTS.MD CONTENT ---
## Issue Tracking

This project uses **bd (beads)** for issue tracking.
Run `bd prime` for workflow context, or install hooks (`bd hooks install`) for auto-injection.

**Quick reference:**
- `bd ready` - Find unblocked work
- `bd create "Title" --type task --priority 2` - Create issue
- `bd close <id>` - Complete work
- `bd sync` - Sync with git (run at session end)

For full workflow details: `bd prime`
--- END AGENTS.MD CONTENT ---

For GitHub Copilot users:
Add the same content to .github/copilot-instructions.md

How it works:
   • bd prime provides dynamic workflow context (~80 lines)
   • bd hooks install auto-injects bd prime at session start
   • AGENTS.md only needs this minimal pointer, not full instructions

This keeps AGENTS.md lean while bd prime provides up-to-date workflow details.
